alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 1:40PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .River and creek levels will remain elevated this afternoon. Flooding will continue for the Willow Brook, the Laguna de Santa Rosa, Mark West Creek, and Colgan Creek. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 138 PM PST, Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. River and creek levels will remain elevated this afternoon. Flooding will continue for the Willow Brook, the Laguna de Santa Rosa, Mark West Creek, and Colgan Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Healdsburg, Sebastopol, Cotati, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Roseland, Larkfield-Wikiup, Forestville, South Santa Rosa, Graton, Glen Ellen, El Verano and Temelec. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
